model

Class PatternFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.PatternFormat

  • public class PatternFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    This class parses, controls, and sets the different data that exists in a RLE file.
    Author:
    Ali Arfan, Kent Erlend Bratteng Knudsen, Stian TornHolm Grimsgaard

    • Constructor Detail

      • PatternFormat

        public PatternFormat(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rleData)
              throws PatternFormatException
        PatternFormat 
         public PatternFormat({@link ArrayList} rleData)

        An object of patternFormat is created using the read data from the RLE file. The data which is parsed into several parts, where the name of the pattern, creator, comment, Life32/Xlife format, array size and the pattern is parsed out, and set according to its given purpose.

        Parameters:
        rleData - - the read String list of data read from the RLE file.
        Throws:
        PatternFormatException - - Throws an exception when the RLE data is incorrect.

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public void decode(java.lang.String data)
        decode 
        public void decode(String data)

        decodes the cell state, where the cell of the state is either dead or alive.

        Parameters:
        data - - A string containing all the state of the cells in the array.

        Parameters:
        patternCreator - - a string containing the name of the author.

        public void setPatternComment(java.lang.String patternComment)

        public void setPatternComment(String patternComment)

        Sets the comment that is specified in the RLE file.

        Parameters:
        patternComment - - a string containing the comments in the RLE file.

      • setPatternSize

        public void setPatternSize(int width,
                           int height)
                    throws PatternFormatException
        setPatternSize 
        public void setPatternSize(Integer width, Integer height)

        An array is created using the dimension of the pattern specified in the loaded file.

        Parameters:
        width - - the width of the pattern, specified as X=Integer in the RLE file .
        height - the height of the pattern, specified as Y=Integerin the RLE file
        Throws:
        PatternFormatException - - throws an exception if the pattern dimensions are negative.

      • setPatternFormat

        public void setPatternFormat(int topLeftX,
                             int topLeftY,
                             boolean XLifeFormat)
                      throws PatternFormatException
        setPatternFormat 
        public void setPatternFormat(Integer topLeftX, Integer topLeftY, Boolean XLifeFormat)

        Sets the format of the pattern which is either Xlife or Life32

        Parameters:
        topLeftX - - the vertical coordinate of the pattern starting from the top left corner.
        topLeftY - - the horizontal coordinate of the pattern starting from the top left corner.
        XLifeFormat - - The value is true if the loaded pattern is the XLife format, else its false.
        Throws:
        PatternFormatException - - Throws an exception if the x or y coordinate is not matching the format.

      • setPatternRule

        public void setPatternRule(java.lang.String ruleString)
                    throws PatternFormatException
        setPatternRule 
        public void setPatternRule(String ruleString)

        Sets the rule of the pattern, which decides how many cells survive or dies.

        Parameters:
        ruleString - - The string containing the rule
        Throws:
        PatternFormatException - - Throws an error if the rule String is invalid.
